result.markdown: --- title: "Scientific Diagrams" author: "Gabriela Palomo-Munoz" date: "15 October, 2022" categories: [] bibliography: references.bib nocite: | @* image: "image.jpg" #draft: true --- ## Scientific Diagrams The following diagrams are not organized in any particular order. At some point, when I have several linked, I'll organize them by categories. 1. **Soares et al. 2022** Islands are becoming taxonomically and functionally more similar after losing unique bird species and gaining common widespread birds. [![](https://fesummaries.files.wordpress.com/2022/10/fecoutinhosoaresimage.jpg?w=1481)](https://fesummaries.files.wordpress.com/2022/10/fecoutinhosoaresimage.jpg?w=1481) 2. **Pilowsky et al. 2022** Modeling the mechanisms that govern the structure and dynamics of biodiversity. [![](https://www.science.org/cms/10.1126/sciadv.abj2271/asset/174b581f-483e-41e2-af5a-b401043fa611/assets/images/large/sciadv.abj2271-f1.jpg)](https://www.science.org/cms/10.1126/sciadv.abj2271/asset/174b581f-483e-41e2-af5a-b401043fa611/assets/images/large/sciadv.abj2271-f1.jpg) 3. **Riva & Nielsen 2020** Six key steps for functional landscape analyses of habitat change [![](https://media.springernature.com/full/springer-static/image/art%3A10.1007%2Fs10980-020-01048-y/MediaObjects/10980_2020_1048_Fig1_HTML.png?as=webp)](https://media.springernature.com/full/springer-static/image/art%3A10.1007%2Fs10980-020-01048-y/MediaObjects/10980_2020_1048_Fig1_HTML.png?as=webp) 4. **Broadley et al. 2019** Space use is one factor affecting detections on CTs. Here, two aspects of space use are considered: home-range size and movement rate. [![](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/6037e2fa-7cc2-4ceb-8e7d-6cafe6925d42/ece35840-fig-0001-m.png)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/6037e2fa-7cc2-4ceb-8e7d-6cafe6925d42/ece35840-fig-0001-m.png) 5. **Naves-Alegre et al. 2022** Results of the spatial and spatio-temporal co-occurrence analyses between pairs of species, both qualitative co-occurrence and quantitative GLMs (spatial co-occurrence) and GLMMs (spatio-temporal co-occurrence) that relate the abundances of the species. [![](https://zslpublications.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/42363a0c-8425-462e-b946-4e26ccaa929b/jzo13016-fig-0002-m.jpg)](https://zslpublications.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/42363a0c-8425-462e-b946-4e26ccaa929b/jzo13016-fig-0002-m.jpg) 6. **Rodrigues et al. 2022** Synthesis of the observed impacts of land-use transition on mean annual evapotranspiration (ET) and average land surface temperature (LST) in the Cerrado. [![](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/fed6febd-795c-48c8-9105-ee9cab518811/gcb16386-fig-0009-m.png)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/fed6febd-795c-48c8-9105-ee9cab518811/gcb16386-fig-0009-m.png) 7. **Palmer et al. 2022** Dynamic landscapes of fear: understanding spatiotemporal risk. [![](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0169534722001409-gr1.jpg)](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0169534722001409-gr1.jpg) [![](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0169534722001409-gr2.jpg)](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0169534722001409-gr2.jpg) [![](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0169534722001409-gr3.jpg)](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0169534722001409-gr3.jpg) 8. **Grames, Schwartz, Elphick. 2022.** Conceptual flowchart of a systematic process to develop conceptual models of alternative hypotheses in which (a) the scope of the research question is formally defined, (b) a systematic review is conducted, (c) researchers extract authors' hypotheses as implied causal relationships that are (d) merged into a graphical model that can be (e) analysed to identify trends in scientific thinking. [![](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/91d10417-db46-4d70-9dc5-e9a95adbbc07/mee313940-fig-0001-m.png)](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/91d10417-db46-4d70-9dc5-e9a95adbbc07/mee313940-fig-0001-m.png) 9. **Magle & Fidino 2018.** Transition probabilities between the three possible states a habitat fragment could transition between from 1 year to the next. [![](https://media.springernature.com/lw685/springer-static/image/art%3A10.1007%2Fs10531-018-1621-z/MediaObjects/10531_2018_1621_Fig1_HTML.png?as=webp)](https://media.springernature.com/lw685/springer-static/image/art%3A10.1007%2Fs10531-018-1621-z/MediaObjects/10531_2018_1621_Fig1_HTML.png?as=webp) 10. **Suraci et al. 2022** Beyond spatial overlap: harnessing new technologies to resolve the complexities of predatorâ€“prey interactions. [![](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/47975cfe-a942-4b75-8ff4-1dadff0ab58d/oik13362-fig-0002-m.png)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/47975cfe-a942-4b75-8ff4-1dadff0ab58d/oik13362-fig-0002-m.png) [![](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/3b1998c2-6f7f-47ad-a0b1-aa1b5c9071bc/oik13362-fig-0003-m.png)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/3b1998c2-6f7f-47ad-a0b1-aa1b5c9071bc/oik13362-fig-0003-m.png) 11. **Gamez & Harris 2022** Conceptual diagram of a vertical forest ecosystem. [![](https://www.cell.com/cms/attachment/3031e70c-11c0-437a-99a9-bca63609a279/gr2.jpg)](https://www.cell.com/cms/attachment/3031e70c-11c0-437a-99a9-bca63609a279/gr2.jpg) 12. **Siren et al. 2022.** Forecasting species distributions: Correlation does not equal causation. [![](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/9149494c-a504-490c-a881-9704b868e81b/ddi13480-fig-0003-m.png)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/cms/asset/9149494c-a504-490c-a881-9704b868e81b/ddi13480-fig-0003-m.png) Back to top # References ::: {#refs} :::
